items.todoItem: Count it all joy when you fall into various temptations.
Don’t complain or get bitter when you face trials in your life.
Know that the trying of our faith produces patience.
Know that the trying of our faith reveals areas of unbelief when we do not trust God or believe He is in control.
Know that the trying of our faith reveals the progress of our spiritual growth to us.
Know that patience is developed in us through trials while we wait in faith for God to act.
Let patience have her perfect work so that you may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing.
Know that God uses adversity to mature His people.
Be patient in the face of adversity.
Learn to trust and wait on God.
Know that God allows you to go through trials so that you might become perfect and entire, wanting nothing.
Consider each trial an opportunity for growth.
Know that each trial can make you bitter or better.
Know that God wants us to become mature.
If you lack wisdom, ask God for it, who gives to all men liberally without reproach.
Know that God gives to all men liberally without reproach.
Know that the wisest and most important thing you can ever do is seek the wisdom of God.
Ask God in faith without doubting.
Know that unwavering faith is faith founded on the promises of God.
Know that wavering faith is ineffective faith.
Know that he that doubts shall not receive any thing of the Lord.
Know that the man that endures temptation shall receive the crown of life.
Know that God cannot be tempted with evil.
Know that God tempts no man.
Let no man say when he is tempted: "I am tempted of God."
Know every man is tempted, when drawn away of his own lust, and enticed.
Know that every good and perfect gift comes down from the Father above.
Know that there is no variableness or shadow of turning in God.
Be slow to anger.
Know that a man’s anger does not demonstrate the righteousness of God.
Be a doer of the word and not a hearer only.
Surrender your tongue.
Visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction.
